reviews.review_msg: A little boring, but teacher is easy to follow and so I thought over all the class was good.

She's a spoon feeder, but I wish more were in first year - considering the HUGE jump in terms of expectations from High School to Univ, you NEED more profs like this who can introduce you to the expectations of Univ. without terrifying you. She's kind, helpful, but yes - very dull - but only because Canada is a really dull country.

Any Canadian history class that can include an electric-guitar/banjo rendition of the House of the Rising Sun is alright in my books. Lecture material was dry (obviously), but he delievered it with enthusiasm and humour. ("I want my gyrocoptor!") Paper assignments were really boring and easy, but may be okay if you're actually a first year.
